home_info.about_me: I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Business and Economics at the University of Southern Denmark and a Research Fellow at IZA. I received my B.A. in Economics from Bogazici University in 2003, and my Ph.D. in Economics from University of Maryland, College Park in 2009. I currently serve as an associate editor at Journal of Health Economics and the chief coordinator of Network on Health Economics. My research agenda lies at the intersection of health economics, labor economics, and economic demography. I teach health economics at the graduate level and econometric methods at the upper undergraduate level.
